summary: The Innovative Therapies Centers of Excellence Act of 2025 mandates the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to establish at least five centers of excellence focused on innovative therapies for veterans. These centers, designated after peer review, will research and provide treatments for conditions like anxiety, chronic pain, and PTSD using therapies such as MDMA, ketamine, and psilocybin. The bill requires geographic distribution of the centers, outlines requirements for designation, and mandates annual reports to Congress. It authorizes $30 million annually for research and education activities.
